alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 09 at 12:22PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Northern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Taiya River. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible. - Areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 12:00pm the stage was 16.45 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Impacts: At 16.1 feet: Portions of the Chilkoot Trail begins to inundate with water. At 16.8 feet: Portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail will begin to inundate with water to ankle depth.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
